botanical_details.genus: Hibiscus can be deciduous or evergreen shrubs, trees, annuals or perennials, with simple or palmately lobed leaves and large, funnel-shaped flowers over a long flowering season

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grows best in neutral to slightly acidic or slightly alkaline, humus-rich, moist but well-drained soil. Plant in a warm sheltered position in full sun to encourage flowering. Can also be grown in pots. Feed in spring, with a slow-release, high potash formula, such as rose food, and mulch in autumn to help maintain soil moisture levels and suppress weeds
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by softwood cuttings in late spring, by semi-ripe cuttings in summer, or by layering in spring or autumn
how_to_grow.pruning: Very little pruning required, just prune away any broken or dead branches after flowering - pruning group 1
how_to_grow.pests: Generally pest free although can occasionally be susceptible to aphids
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to Powdery mildews
